channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Senator, broadcaster Eddie Ilarde, 85
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Former senator Eddie Ilarde, who became famous for his stint as a host of a noontime show in the ’80s, died yesterday at the age of 85.

item.title: No plan to ban TikTok in Philippines — Roque
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: There is no plan to ban the Chinese video-sharing application TikTok in the Philippines, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said yesterday, adding that there are no efforts to stifle the constitutionally protected freedom of expression in the country.

item.title: New 1-day record: COVID-19 cases hit 6,532
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health yesterday reported 6,352 new cases of COVID-19 in the country, a new record in one-day increase, bringing the total number of cases to 112,593.

item.title: MECQ ‘good enough’ for doctors
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Medical frontliners are hopeful that the two-week modified enhanced community quarantine in Metro Manila and four nearby provinces will be “good enough” for the government to “re-calibrate” the country’s response to COVID-19.

item.title: Doctors push for RT-PCR stoppage
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: Rapid antibody and realtime-polymerase chain reaction tests should not be used as screening tools for workers before they are allowed to return to work, doctors said yesterday.

item.title: PNP won’t call for timeout
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: Philippine National Police chief Gen. Archie Gamboa has ordered an evaluation of health workers within the PNP, but ruled out calling for a timeout similar to the appeal made by medical frontliners as the country grapples with the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: LGUs urged to go house-to-house for passes
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: Only house-to-house distribution of quarantine passes will be allowed in Metro Manila and nearby provinces placed under modified enhanced community quarantine until Aug.18, according to the Department of the Interior and Local Government.

item.title: Social media regulation not covered by terror law – Palace
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Malacañang yesterday countered the proposal of newly installed Armed Forces of the Philippines chief Lt. Gen. Gilbert Gapay to use the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 and its implementing rules and regulations to regulate social media.

item.title: 3 million delisted from cash aid list
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The number of families that would receive the second tranche of subsidy for poor households has gone down to 14.1 million, the Department of Social Welfare and Development said yesterday.

item.title: ‘PhilHealth not perfect, has wicked problems’
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Admitting that the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. is not perfect, the organization’s president said they have “wicked problems” which cannot be solved even by changing its leadership weekly.
